definition: Cao Xueqin (c. 1715-c. 1764), accepted author of A Dream of Red Mansions 紅樓夢|红楼梦[Hong2 lou2 Meng4]
class or grade/generation/plaintiff and defendant (old)/government department (old)
surname Cao/Zhou Dynasty vassal state
snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean
surname Xue
Chinese celery

sentences.english: I also love classical literature, and Cao Xueqin is one of my favorite authors.
sentences.chinese: 我還喜歡古典文學，曹雪芹是我最喜歡的作家之一。

sentences.english: Dream most level than Cao Xueqin.
sentences.chinese: 夢做的最有水平的要數曹雪芹了。

sentences.english: Jia Baoyu reflected the tragic experiences of Cao Xueqin.
sentences.chinese: 賈寶玉體現了曹雪芹的悲劇感受。

sentences.english: In The Dream of Red Mansion, Cao Xueqin portrayed a female character-Qin Keqing.
sentences.chinese: 在《紅樓夢》中，曹雪芹塑造了秦可卿這位女性。

sentences.english: No. 436, Caoxueqin West Avenue, Fengrun District, Tangshan City, Hebei Province, China.
sentences.chinese: 中國，河北，唐山市，豐潤區曹雪芹西道436號。

sentences.english: The author was Cao Xueqin of the Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 作者是清代文學家曹雪芹。

sentences.english: This is a full-length novel written by Cao Xueqin.
sentences.chinese: 《紅樓夢》是清朝作家曹雪芹創作的長篇小說。

sentences.english: Cao Xueqin s father is Cao Yong or Cao Fu, the Hong studies up to now did not have the solution.
sentences.chinese: 曹雪芹的父親到底是曹顒還是曹頫，紅學界迄今無解。

sentences.english: Finally, I thought whether there would be a Tea Bar called Cao Xueqin in the capital airport.
sentences.chinese: 也想到首都機場是否也可以有一個叫曹雪芹的茶社。

sentences.english: Chapter One discusses the leitmotiv of the former eighty chapters.
sentences.chinese: 第一章論述了曹雪芹前八十回《紅樓夢》的立意本旨。

definition: A Dream of Red Mansions (first completed edition 1791) by Cao Xueqin 曹雪芹[Cao2 Xue3 qin2], one of the four great novels
Jia Baoyu, male character in The Dream of Red Mansions, in love with his cousin Lin Daiyu 林黛玉 but obliged to marry Xue Baochai 薛寶釵|薛宝钗
sequel/continuation of a book
Lin Daiyu, female character in The Dream of Red Mansions, cousin and thwarted lover of Jia Baoyu 賈寶玉|贾宝玉
Xue Baochai, female character in Dream of Red Mansions, married to Jia Baoyu 賈寶玉|贾宝玉
Kong Shangren (1648-1718), Qing dramatist and poet, author of The Peach Blossom Fan 桃花扇[Tao2 hua1 Shan4]
Lanling Xiaoxiaosheng, pseudonym of the Ming dynasty writer and author of the Golden Lotus 金瓶梅[Jin1 ping2 mei2]
Wu Jingzi (1701-1754), Qing dynasty novelist, author of The Scholars 儒林外史[Ru2 lin2 Wai4 shi3]
Li Ruzhen (c. 1763-c. 1830), Qing novelist and phonologist, author of fantasy novel Jinghua Yuan 鏡花緣|镜花缘 or Flowers in the Mirror
precious jade/treasures
Liu Xinwu (1942-), novelist
Pu Songling (1640-1715), author of 聊齋志異|聊斋志异[Liao2 zhai1 Zhi4 yi4]
Wang Shifu (fl. 1295-1307), author of Romance of the West Chamber 西廂記|西厢记
The Scholars, Qing dynasty novel by Wu Jingzi 吳敬梓|吴敬梓[Wu2 Jing4 zi3], an extended satire on the Imperial Examination system
Yuan Mei (1716-1798), famous Qing poet and critic, one of Three great poets of the Qianlong era 乾嘉三大家
Guan Hanqing (c. 1235-c. 1300), Yuan dynasty dramatist in the 雜劇|杂剧 tradition of musical comedy, one of the Four Great Yuan dramatists 元曲四大家
